src:
Klari Dulc je moda nenehen izziv
02 Nov 2019, 10:20 by L. Markelj, L. Markelj, osebni arhiv K. D.



Klara Dulc v svoji šivalnici, ki je njen svet. Na sliki z eno izmed svojih zaniivih kreacij, kje se vidi njena ljubeze do gubanja, volumna.



Za to kreacijo je Klara prejela priznanje Lune.



Z modne revije v Novem mestu


Dobrava pri Škocjanu - Obleka naredi človeka. Povej mi, kaj nosiš, in povem ti, kdo si. To sta le dva znana reka, ki govorita o tem, da je pomembno, kako se oblačimo, kako urejeni hodimo po svetu.
A pri tem nimamo v mislih mode, ki se kar naprej spreminja, ampak to, da vsak najde svoj stil oblačenja, ki mu ustreza. To zagovarja tudi 24-letna Klara Dulc iz Dobrave pri Škocjanu, diplomirana oblikovalka tekstilij in oblačil, ki se bliža koncu študija, saj obiskuje zadnji letnik Naravoslovnotehniške fakultete v Ljubljani.
Mlada in ambiciozna oblikovalka je že kot študentka zelo delovna in ustvarjalna, sodelovala je na kar nekaj modnih revijah in pripravila zanimive kolekcije tako za ženske kot moške, tudi v Novem mestu.
Oblikovanje jo zanima od malih nog. Kot pove, je vedno rada risala oblekice z detajli, navdih so ji bile risanke in filmi. Preoblačila je barbike in si dala duška z najzanimivejšimi kombinacijami. Medtem ko mnoge mamice dolga leta izbirajo oblačila za svoje otroke, Klarina tega ni mogla prav dolgo. »Že kot majhna sem se želela obleči po svoje, malo drugače,« pove Klara in doda, da se zaveda, da je bilo nakupovanje oblačil z njo zelo naporno. »Imela sem posebne želje, zamisli, ki jih je bilo včasih težko razumeti,« se nasmeje.
Po osnovni šoli v Škocjanu se je Klara vpisala na Ekonomsko gimnazijo v Novem mestu, izbira študija pa kmalu ni bila več vprašanje - že po prvem letniku je vedela, da bo to Oblikovanje oblačil in tekstilij. Kot se spominja, so bili sprejemni izpiti zelo zahtevni, trajali so kar dva dni.
S študijem je zadovoljna, veliko je risanja in poudarka na ročnih tehnikah, oblikovanju oblačil in umetnosti. Vsako leto raziskujejo novo temo, ki je izhodišče za kolekcijo, in vsak naredi izhod, to pomeni, da kreira obleko, ki jo predstavi pred vsemi. V prvem letniku se tako spominja, da je naredila dve obleki, v 4. letniku pa že kar sedem. »Zanimivo je, kako se vsak loti zadeve, kako po svoje interpretira kolekcijo, učiš se tudi od drugih,« pravi Klara in doda, kakšno motivacijo ji je pomenilo posebno priznanje Lune za eno od svojih kreacij v 2. letniku študija.
Več o njenem sodelovanju na modnih revijah v Ljubljani, pa tudi v Novem mestu, o njenem pogledu na modo ter načrtih in ciljih, pa si preberite v prilogi Živa v aktualnem Dolenjskem listu.

text:
Clari Dulc is a constant fashion challenge
02 Nov 2019, 10:20 by L. Markelj, L. Markelj, personal archive of K. D.



Clara Dulc in her sewing room, which is her world. Pictured with one of her curious creations, where her love of wrinkling, volume is seen.



For this creation, Clara received the Moon's recognition.



From a fashion show in Novo mesto


Dobrava pri Skocjan - Dress makes a man. Tell me what you wear and I'll tell you who you are. These are just two known rivers that talk about the importance of dressing, how we walk the world in order.
However, we are not thinking of a fashion that is constantly changing, but that everyone finds his own style of dress that suits him. This is also advocated by 24-year-old Klara Dulc from Dobrava near Skocjan, a graduate of textile and clothing design who is nearing the end of her studies as she attends the final year of the Faculty of Natural Sciences and Engineering in Ljubljana.
A young and ambitious designer, as a student, she is very hardworking and creative, has participated in quite a few fashion shows and produced interesting collections for women and men, including in Novo mesto.
She has been interested in design since she was little. As she says, she always liked to draw dresses with details, and she was inspired by cartoons and movies. She transformed the barbecues and gave herself a shower with the most interesting combinations. While many moms have been choosing clothes for their children for many years, Klarina couldn't do that for long. "When I was little, I wanted to dress in my own way, a little differently," says Clara, adding that she was aware that shopping with her clothes was very arduous. "I had special desires, ideas that were sometimes hard to understand," he laughs.
After elementary school in Skocjan, Klara enrolled in the Economics High School in Novo mesto, and her choice of studies was soon no longer an issue - she knew from the first year that it would be Designing of clothes and textiles. As she recalls, the entrance exams were very challenging, lasting as long as two days.
She is satisfied with her studies, there is a lot of drawing and emphasis on hand techniques, clothing design and art. Each year, they explore a new theme, which is the starting point for the collection, and each one makes an exit, that is, to create a dress to present in front of everyone. In her first year, she remembers making two outfits, and in her seventh year she made as many as seven. "It's interesting how each person deals with the subject, how he interprets the collection in his own way, you learn from others as well," says Klara, adding that she was motivated by the special recognition of the moon for one of her creations in her sophomore year.
You can read more about her participation in fashion shows in Ljubljana, as well as in Novo mesto, her outlook on fashion and plans and goals in the Ziva appendix in the current Dolenjski list.
